title: Transaction is being added as pending and not propagating to network
body:
#### System information

erigon version 2021.10.2-alpha
git_branch=stable git_tag=v2021.10.02 git_commit=8b4d31f6617a051285e62ef065d4a9de2a439fb2
OS & Version: Alpine Linux / Docker / Based on official example file
Network: Goerli Testnet

Docker compose config (rpcdaemon in remote mode) :

```yml
services:
  erigon_testnet:
    image: thorax/erigon:stable
    ports:
      - "30303:30303/tcp"
      - "30303:30303/udp"
      - "30304:30304/tcp"
      - "30304:30304/udp"
    command: erigon --chain goerli --private.api.addr=0.0.0.0:9090
    ....
  rpcdaemon:
    image: thorax/erigon:stable
    command: rpcdaemon --private.api.addr=erigon_testnet:9090 --http.addr=0.0.0.0 --http.vhosts=* --http.corsdomain=* --http.api=eth,erigon,web3,net,debug,trace,txpool
    container_name: rpcdaemon
    ports:
      - "18545:8545"
    links:
      - erigon_testnet
    ....
```

Commit hash: 8b4d31f6617a051285e62ef065d4a9de2a439fb2

#### Expected behaviour

Once broadcast - transactions are properly propagated across network.

#### Actual behaviour

Using ``eth_sendRawTransaction`` transaction is being added as pending and not propagated. I can see lines "Transaction stats         pending=1 queued=0" in the logs.
If I broadcast same tx again it finally gets propagated but call itself returns error "ALREADY_EXISTS: already known"

erigon logs:
```
[INFO] [10-08|21:36:47.348] [17/18 TxPool] Transaction stats         pending=0 queued=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:36:47.546] Commit cycle                             in=198.63469ms
[INFO] [10-08|21:36:47.547] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=5637148 to=5637149
[INFO] [10-08|21:36:47.547] [1/18 Headers] Waiting for headers...    from=5637149
[INFO] [10-08|21:36:52.356] local tx propagated                      to_peers_amount=3 tx_hash=0x4a9109b9a14ebe94bddaf9175cd3343198f1e3127bda9fcd40a3e2c25375c47e
[INFO] [10-08|21:36:53.650] [p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=0 eth65=3
[INFO] [10-08|21:36:54.667] local tx propagated                      to_peers_amount=3 tx_hash=0x4a9109b9a14ebe94bddaf9175cd3343198f1e3127bda9fcd40a3e2c25375c47e
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:02.131] [1/18 Headers] Processed                 highest inserted=5637150 age=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:02.135] [7/18 Execution] Completed on            block=5637150
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:02.137] [17/18 TxPool] Transaction stats         pending=1 queued=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:02.159] Commit cycle                             in=22.566555ms
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:02.160] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=5637149 to=5637150
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:02.160] [1/18 Headers] Waiting for headers...    from=5637150
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:17.632] [1/18 Headers] Processed                 highest inserted=5637151 age=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:17.662] [7/18 Execution] Completed on            block=5637151
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:17.668] [17/18 TxPool] Transaction stats         pending=1 queued=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:37:17.835] Commit cycle                             in=166.597931ms
...
```
rpcdaemon logs
```
[INFO] [10-08|21:36:52.358] Submitted transaction                    hash=0x4a9109b9a14ebe94bddaf9175cd3343198f1e3127bda9fcd40a3e2c25375c47e from=0xF6e9979cA2701e6d877644FC6bA1C4Ed92195d8C nonce=7 recipient=0x4A60484589F87cBcEa971304d95d16329403FE02 value=0x38d7ea4c68000
```

If I broadcast same tx again it finally gets propagated and the logs are following:

erigon logs (these blank lines are as it was):
```
[INFO] [10-08|21:39:47.273] [17/18 TxPool] Transaction stats         pending=1 queued=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:39:47.320] [7/18 Execution] Completed on            block=5637161
[INFO] [10-08|21:39:47.402] [17/18 TxPool] Transaction stats         pending=1 queued=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:39:47.854] Commit cycle                             in=452.07164ms
[INFO] [10-08|21:39:47.855] RPC Daemon notified of new headers       from=5637159 to=5637161
[INFO] [10-08|21:39:47.855] [1/18 Headers] Waiting for headers...    from=5637161


[INFO] [10-08|21:40:02.341] [1/18 Headers] Processed                 highest inserted=5637162 age=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:40:02.489] [7/18 Execution] Completed on            block=5637162
[INFO] [10-08|21:40:02.537] [17/18 TxPool] Transaction stats         pending=0 queued=0
[INFO] [10-08|21:40:03.175] Commit cycle                             in=638.314932ms
```

rpcdaemon logs
```
[WARN] [10-08|21:39:54.781] Served                                   conn=54.156.203.148:57246 method=eth_sendRawTransaction reqid=0 t=1.334861ms err="ALREADY_EXISTS: already known"
```

`[p2p] GoodPeers                          eth66=0 eth65=3` maybe you just have not enough good peers (maybe you propagated txs to them, but the didn't further or did for "not enough big part of network").
Yesterday I merged to `devel` fix which increasing number of good peers (we did drop some good peers) - maybe this will solve your problem.

Fixed 1 problem related to dropping some good peers: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/2807
maybe can help you

@AskAlexSharov It seems this is not related to quality of peers. My previous log was not the best example as I've just restarted erigon, but this issue is also present with any number of good peers. 

I just updated to most recent version:
Build info  git_branch=devel git_tag=v2021.10.02 git_commit=f4dee877946cef717239917d6060ea9644dd6c88

And issue is still present, here are the logs. I see multiple times mentioned txid `0x302e469fdb1521e6d41e91a9a9b5d65fd01f6d8eae17d1992802cd0e4feb5f67` I broadcasted, but it always stays as pending=1.

Also if this would be peer related, why second rebroadcast (even doing it after less than 1s) helps it to propagate properly.

I also reported this same problem in Discord earlier this month, as did another user, hundreds of peers, yet no other node on the network sees the pending tx

We've had to reroute the entire eth_sendRawTransaction method. The issue isn't even intermittent, it happens very frequently.
We will do release with one more fix for this issue after tomorrow
It's released by v2021.10.05. Feel free to try.
Hi. One more bugfix merged to “stable” and “devel”. Feel free to try. (Releases every Thursday)
No more an issue in recent versions.
